name: Frisbee Pie Tin
description: A tin pie plate used as a makeshift weapon by Marty McFly in 1885.

content.title: Overview
content.body: The Frisbee Pie Tin is a humble kitchen item used as a pie plate, which played a significant role as an impromptu weapon in *Back to the Future Part III*.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: It is a round, metallic tin with the word 'Frisbie' engraved on it, used originally for holding pies.

content.title: Function
content.body: While primarily designed for baking pies, it was used by Marty McFly to deflect a thrown plate in a saloon, demonstrating its dual use as a defensive tool.

content.title: History
content.body: The Frisbie Pie Tin originated in the late 19th century, produced by the Frisbie Pie Company. In the film, it becomes a centerpiece in linking to the future invention of the frisbee toy.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: During a confrontation in the Palace Saloon, Marty McFly uses the pie tin to fend off an attack, showcasing his resourcefulness. This moment cleverly ties into the real-world invention of the frisbee, connecting past and future.
